result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Anthony Morales

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnny Anthony Morales not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Johnny Anthony Morales.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny Anthony Morales not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Johnny Anthony Morales.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defendant has an additional pending case and defense counsel requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnny Anthony Morales in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Johnny Anthony Morales.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Discussions with parties. Court withdraws stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel has received discovery materials, but is requesting additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a pre-trial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Calendar call scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with C.K.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES:
Defendant Johnny Anthony Morales in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Johnny Anthony Morales in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
As to Count 2:   Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
